intro: Sinosidus albescens var. glandulosus, commonly known as the glandular sinosidus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
